column4: When I used Windows I used a LaTeX editor (LEd) which had a built in DVI viewer. Is there anything like that for ubuntu?
use tetex or texlive2007, xdvi works pretty well
a dvi previwer it is quite famous in the Unix world
you can use kile, or gedit or kate or vim and so. There are guides with more info in the forums. Kile seems like the best choice.
a built-in dvi viewer seems kind of strange. Just editing, compiling and previewing is not hard.
I have installed "tetex-base" and "tetex-extra", I edit my files with "gedit", compile with the terminal, "latex file", and preview with "xdvi file".
yes naturally. Search the packages with "aptitude search tetex"
in nautilus? that is odd, I never thought of that.
well there is a list view, although I must say I don't recall the exact windows thing either
most probably you are using an ATI or Nvidia card so see !ati
you need to ask someone in your family... No. Seriously, you should know. Try "lspci -nv" and check the card.
VGA compatible controller: Intel Corporation Mobile 945GM/GMS/940GML Express Integrated Graphics Controller (rev 03)
that is useful info. Now browse the forums for more info.
I was hoping t would be easier than that :) Thanks for your help
It may be easy, I just don't have personal experience with Intel. It maybe a single command, or a single edition of /etc/X11/xorg.conf, but I can't be sure.
